theories.name: Communities of Practice (Wenger)
theories.rationale: The model already captures trajectories from newcomers to the core via Skill up and Promotion Rate and includes mentorship as a social learning mechanism. However, Wenger’s theory emphasizes legitimate peripheral participation and identity/belonging, which are not yet operationalized as entry and retention dynamics. Adding onboarding, peripheral access quality, mentor capacity constraints, and a belonging-based attrition mechanism makes participation and movement from periphery to core explicit and testable. This improves behavioral realism by introducing capacity limits and dropout loops that shape community sustainability.

variables.name: Newcomer Onboarding Rate
variables.description: Rate at which outsiders become New Contributors through legitimate peripheral participation.

variables.name: Peripheral Access Quality
variables.description: Ease for newcomers to find tasks, tools, norms, and social entry points.

variables.name: Core Developer Mentoring Capacity
variables.description: Effective throughput of mentorship support available from Core Developers given time and load.

variables.name: Mentor Load per Core Dev
variables.description: Mentee-to-mentor load ratio experienced by Core Developers.

variables.name: New Contributor Attrition Rate
variables.description: Rate at which New Contributors disengage and leave the community.

variables.name: Sense of Belonging
variables.description: Perceived inclusion and identification with the community that influences retention.

theories.name: Nonaka's SECI Model
theories.rationale: The current model includes socialization via mentorship and references explicit knowledge transfer, but it lacks a stock of explicit knowledge and the dynamics of creation and decay central to SECI. Introducing Project's Explicit Knowledge with creation and obsolescence flows closes the externalization–combination side of the spiral, while Internalization Effectiveness links explicit knowledge back to capability growth. Tying externalization to experienced contributors and routing internalization to Skill up yields a compact, testable SECI loop that can co-evolve with mentorship.

variables.name: Project's Explicit Knowledge
variables.description: Accumulated body of maintained documentation, guides, and codified practices.

variables.name: Documentation Creation Rate
variables.description: Rate of converting tacit know-how into documented assets (externalization).

variables.name: Documentation Obsolescence Rate
variables.description: Rate at which explicit content becomes outdated or is retired.

variables.name: Externalization Effort
variables.description: Time and resources allocated to authoring and curating documentation.

variables.name: Internalization Effectiveness
variables.description: Effectiveness with which contributors turn explicit content into usable skills.
